title: American explorer trapped in Turkey cave could be hours away from journey to surface
description: American explorer Mark Dickey, who is trapped in one of the world’s deepest caves, could be just hours away from beginning his long journey to the surface. It’s been nearly a week since a frightening illness stranded him 3,400 feet underground. NBC News’ Matt Bradley is in Turkey with the latest.

title: Panama to increase deportations in face of record migration through the Darien Gap
description: Panama will increase infrastructure in the jungle area along its shared border with Colombia known as the Darien Gap — as well as ramp up deportations — to contain a record-breaking flow of migrants passing through there this year.

title: Abortion win in Mexico a template amid U.S. struggle, say activists
description: After Mexico decriminalized abortion nationwide, Latin American activists think U.S. activists should turn to Mexico to learn how to navigate a post Roe reality.

title: Iran and the U.S. appear to have dialed back tensions, but the risks remain high
description: There are growing signs both Iran and the U.S. have taken steps to lower tensions recently, though the de-escalation is tentative and could easily crumble.

title: Norwegian man discovers rare gold treasure after buying metal detector
description: Erlend Bore, 51, took up the metal detecting as a leisurely hobby, but stumbled across a gold treasure trove dating back more than 1,500 years.

title: U.N. says goal of achieving gender equality by 2030 is impossible due to biases against women
description: The United Nations goal of achieving gender equality by 2030 is impossible to attain because of deeply rooted biases against women around the world, the U.N. said in a report Thursday.

title: Norway man with metal detector makes gold 'find of the century'
description: A Norwegian man had barely unwrapped his new metal detector when he discovered what experts have described as the “gold find of the century.”

title: Spanish prosecutors file sexual assault and coercion complaint against Luis Rubiales over unwanted World Cup kiss
description: Spanish state prosecutors have accused Luis Rubiales of sexual assault and coercion for kissing a player on the lips without her consent after the Women’s World Cup final, the country’s prosecutors’ office said Friday.

title: Biden and Narendra Modi look to tighten US-India ties as concerns rise over China
description: Biden and Narendra Modi have looked to tighten U.S.-India ties amid concerns over China, climate change, artificial intelligence and global supply chains.

title: Heaviest rainfall in more than a century floods and paralyzes Hong Kong
description: Heavy rain not seen in more than a century brought Hong Kong to a standstill on Friday, with record rainfall shutting down the city and Shenzhen, southern China.

title: Ukraine is furious with Elon Musk for thwarting an attack on Russia's navy
description: Tech billionaire Elon Musk has come under fire from Ukraine after it emerged he thwarted a major attack on the Russian navy in Crimea by refusing his Starlink satellite network be turned on.

title: Kim Jong Un launching new submarine shown on North Korean TV
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un attended a recent launch of a new submarine. North Korean media say it has nuclear attack capabilities.

title: Black storm warning in Hong Kong as over 6 inches of rain falls in one hour
description: Heavy rain in Hong Kong overnight flooded city streets and some subway stations, with hundreds evacuated and two deaths reported.

title: Al Qaeda-linked insurgents in Mali kill 49 civilians and 15 soldiers in attacks
description: Two attacks by Al Qaeda linked insurgents in the restive north of Mali on Thursday killed 49 civilians and 15 government soldiers, the country’s military junta said.

title: Palestinian leader’s comments on Holocaust draw accusations of antisemitism from U.S. and Europe
description: The United States, Germany and the European Union on Thursday condemned recent comments about the Holocaust by Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas, accusing him of distorting history and promoting antisemitic stereotypes.

title: King Charles thanks public for their ‘love’ as he marks death of Queen Elizabeth II
description: King Charles III on Friday thanked the public for their “love and support” on the first anniversary of the death of his mother Queen Elizabeth II and his accession to the throne, echoing her words as he vowed to be of service to all.

title: Effort to free American trapped in Turkey cave to begin as soon as Friday
description: MERSIN PROVINCE, Turkey — Turkish rescuers are ready to being the process of freeing an American caver stuck over 3,000 feet underground within the next few days, an emergency management official said Thursday.

title: Chinese social media campaigns are successfully impersonating U.S. voters, Microsoft warns
description: A suspected China state-affiliated influence campaign impersonating U.S. voters on social media is succeeding at reaching authentic users, Microsoft said.

title: North Korea says it has deployed a new nuclear attack submarine to counter U.S. naval power
description: North Korea said Friday it has christened a purported nuclear attack submarine in an effort to counter the United States and its Asian allies.
